noun.description: A person who sees an event, typically a crime or accident, take place.
examples: police are appealing for witnesses to the accident
I was witness to one of the most amazing comebacks in sprinting history
the memorial service was witness to the wide circle of his interest

noun.description: A member of the Jehovah's Witnesses.

verb.description: See (an event, typically a crime or accident) take place.
examples: a bartender who witnessed the murder

verb.description: Have knowledge of (an event or change) from personal observation or experience.
examples: what we are witnessing is the birth of a new political entity

verb.description: (of a person) openly profess one's religious faith.
examples: our duty is to witness to God

phrases: God be my witness, sir, I didn't!
Now I know, as God is my witness, unless I'm senile no 5 year old is going to be talking to me that way.
But as God is my witness, I'm not getting a little dog that fits into a Burbury tote.
This altar's here, and as God is my witness, what else is a church for?
But as God is my witness, I am going to drive perfectly from now on.
